verses.text: Now it came to pass on the \w third|strong="H7992"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, that \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* put \w on|strong="H3847"\w* \add her\add* \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \add apparel\add*, and \w stood|strong="H5975"\w* in the \w inner|strong="H6442"\w* \w court|strong="H2691"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, over \w against|strong="H5227"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* upon his \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* in the \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, over \w against|strong="H5227"\w* the \w gate|strong="H6607"\w* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

And it was so, when the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w standing|strong="H5975"\w* in the \w court|strong="H2691"\w*, \add that\add* she \w obtained|strong="H5375"\w* \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* in his \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* held \w out|strong="H3447"\w* to \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w golden|strong="H2091"\w* \w sceptre|strong="H8275"\w* that \add was\add* in his \w hand|strong="H3027"\w*. So \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* drew \w near|strong="H7126"\w*, and \w touched|strong="H5060"\w* the \w top|strong="H7218"\w* of the \w sceptre|strong="H8275"\w*.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* unto her, What wilt thou, \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*? and what \add is\add* thy \w request|strong="H1246"\w*? it shall be even \w given|strong="H5414"\w* thee to the \w half|strong="H2677"\w* of the \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w*.

And \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, If \add it seem\add* \w good|strong="H2895"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, let the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* unto the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* that I have \w prepared|strong="H6213"\w* for him.

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Cause \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* to make \w haste|strong="H4116"\w*, that he may \w do|strong="H6213"\w* as \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* hath \w said|strong="H1697"\w*. So the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* that \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* had \w prepared|strong="H6213"\w*.

¶ And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* at the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* of \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, What \add is\add* thy \w petition|strong="H7596"\w*? and it shall be \w granted|strong="H5414"\w* thee: and what \add is\add* thy \w request|strong="H1246"\w*? even to the \w half|strong="H2677"\w* of the \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w* it shall be \w performed|strong="H6213"\w*.
Then \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, My \w petition|strong="H7596"\w* and my \w request|strong="H1246"\w* \add is;\add*

If I have \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and if it \w please|strong="H2895"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* to \w grant|strong="H5414"\w* my \w petition|strong="H7596"\w*, and to \w perform|strong="H6213"\w* my \w request|strong="H1246"\w*, let the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* that I shall \w prepare|strong="H6213"\w* for them, and I will \w do|strong="H6213"\w* to \w morrow|strong="H4279"\w* as the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* hath \w said|strong="H1697"\w*.\f + \fr 5.8 \ft perform: Heb. do\f*

¶ Then \w went|strong="H3318"\w* \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w joyful|strong="H8056"\w* and with a \w glad|strong="H2896"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*: but when \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* in the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*, that he stood not \w up|strong="H6965"\w*, nor \w moved|strong="H2111"\w* for him, \w he|strong="H2001"\w* was \w full|strong="H4390"\w* of \w indignation|strong="H2534"\w* against \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*.

Nevertheless \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w refrained|strong="H0662"\w* himself: and when he \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \w home|strong="H1004"\w*, he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* and \w called|strong="H0935"\w* for his \w friends|strong="H0157"\w*, and \w Zeresh|strong="H2238"\w* his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*.\f + \fr 5.10 \ft called…: Heb. caused to come\f*

And \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w told|strong="H5608"\w* them of the \w glory|strong="H3519"\w* of his \w riches|strong="H6239"\w*, and the \w multitude|strong="H7230"\w* of his \w children|strong="H1121"\w*, and all \add the things\add* wherein the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* had \w promoted|strong="H1431"\w* him, and how he had \w advanced|strong="H5375"\w* him above the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* and \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

\w Haman|strong="H2001"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* moreover, Yea, \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w* did let no man come \w in|strong="H0935"\w* with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* unto the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w* that she had \w prepared|strong="H6213"\w* but myself; and to \w morrow|strong="H4279"\w* am I \w invited|strong="H7121"\w* unto her also with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.

Yet all this \w availeth|strong="H7737"\w* me nothing, so long \w as|strong="H6256"\w* I \w see|strong="H7200"\w* \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* the \w Jew|strong="H3064"\w* \w sitting|strong="H3427"\w* at the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*.

¶ Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w Zeresh|strong="H2238"\w* his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* and all his \w friends|strong="H0157"\w* unto him, Let a \w gallows|strong="H6086"\w* be \w made|strong="H6213"\w* of \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* \w cubits|strong="H0520"\w* \w high|strong="H1364"\w*, and to \w morrow|strong="H1242"\w* \w speak|strong="H0559"\w* thou unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* that \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* may be \w hanged|strong="H8518"\w* thereon: then \w go|strong="H0935"\w* thou in \w merrily|strong="H8056"\w* with the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* unto the \w banquet|strong="H4960"\w*. And the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* \w pleased|strong="H3190"\w* \w Haman|strong="H2001"\w*; and he \w caused|strong="H6213"\w* the \w gallows|strong="H6086"\w* to be \w made|strong="H6213"\w*.\f + \fr 5.14 \ft gallows: Heb. tree\f*
